result.execSummary:
The defendant William R Caughlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court IMPOSES & STAYS 6 months jail, with Huber, consecutive to 14CF178 and any other and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, concurrent, with conditions:

miscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge

--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Enroll in and complete a course of therapy/treatment in Anger Management
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No direct or indirect contact with Tanya Wolf
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No acts/threats of violence 
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--Subject to random drug & alcohol testing at the discretion of Agent
--No possession of drug paraphernalia
--No contact with any known drug offender, except as approved by Agent

Arresting Agency:  Jefferson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 14CF178, 14CF202 & 14CF332 called together at 10:41 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant William R Caughlin in court, in custody, with Attorney Robert W. Buckett. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Ct#1-14CF332, Ct#1-14CF202 & Ct#1-14CF178; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining Counts in each case

On Count #1-14CF178, the Court IMPOSES & STAYS 6 months jail, with Huber, consecutive to any other previously imposed sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, concurrent, with conditions:
On Count #1-14CF202, the Court IMPOSES & STAYS 6 months jail, with Huber, consecutive to 14CF178 and any other and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, concurrent, with conditions: 
On Count #1-14CF332, the Court IMPOSES & STAYS 9 months jail, with Huber, consecutive to 14CF178 & 14CF202 and any other previously imposed sentence, and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, concurrent, with conditions: 
--serve 5 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges (on Ct#1-14CF1478) to fo to Veteran's Affairs Office in the Jefferson County Courthouse to inquire about treatment options & to go to Tyson to apply for employment & if hired, may start work immediately; to commence forthwith
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Enroll in and complete a course of therapy/treatment in Anger Management
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No direct or indirect contact with Tanya Wolf
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No acts/threats of violence 
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--Subject to random drug & alcohol testing at the discretion of Agent
--No possession of drug paraphernalia
--No contact with any known drug offender, except as approved by Agent
--To pay costs of $
804 ($268 each count)
--To pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge (14CF178)
--To pay $750 DNA Surcharge ($250 each count)

Days credit for time already served: 3 days
-14CF178 (5/24-5/27/14)
Days credit for time already served: 3 days-14CF202 (6/8-6/11/14)
Days credit for time already served: 43 days-14CF332 (9/18-10/30/14)

Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Court orders Mr. Caughlin to report to Probation within 24 hours of release, if Agent has not met with him prior to release
Recess: 11:13 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Cases 14CF178, 14CF202 & 14CF332 called together at 8:40 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant William R Caughlin in court, in-custody, with Attorney Robert W. Buckett. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

14CF332:
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Caughlin waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
 
As to all cases: Atty Buckett: Did have offer on earlier cases, but with new charges, that offer has now been revoked. Will informally pre-try matter with ADA Beck and request matter be set for anticipated plea/sentencing. 
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 8:44 am 

NEXT: ALL CASES: (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing for 10/31/14 at 10:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on October 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 3, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Cases 14CF178 & 14CF202 called together at 1:31 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant William R Caughlin in court with Attorney Robert W. Buckett.  ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court vacates warrant

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Caughlin waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending

NEXT: BOTH CASES (1) DA PTC scheduled for 9/3/14 at 2:00 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 10/3/14 at 1:30 pm - Send notices
Preliminary hearing on August 15, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Cases 14CF178 & 14CF202 called together at 8:58 am [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for Preliminary Hearing)
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Attorney Robert W. Buckett in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Buckett: Have had contact with client, was able to reach him by phone, is not feeling well today and can not make it in. Requests matters be set next week for preliminary hearing and stay any warrant until that time - did speak with Clerk prior to hearing and found a date next week that would work.
ADA Shock: Presents concerns regarding non-appearance, but no objection on scheduling requested
On each case, the Court orders issuance of bench warrant - Body Only - Court STAYS the warrant until 8/15/14 at 1:15 pm - If the Defendant appears warrants will vacate, if Defendant does not appear, then warrants will issue.
Court confirms waiver of time limits
Recess: 9:01 am 

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) Reschedule Preliminary Hearing 8/15/14 at 1:15 pm (Will be Waiver) - Send notices
Preliminary hearing on August 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Cases 14CF178 & 14CF202 called together at 9:46 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant William R Caughlin in court with Attorney Robert W Buckett. ADA Jeffrey M Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Buckett: Requests matters be set for preliminary hearing, would then request matter be set for DA PTC & STC
ADA Shock: No objection
Atty Buckett continues waiver of time limits
Court confirms address on file is accurate for Mr. Caughlin

NEXT: (1) Schedule BOTH CASES for preliminary hearing 8/8/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on June 27, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 3:14 pm
Defendant William R Caughlin in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. ADA Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Svehlek advises the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Court reviews previous conflict review worksheet and continues to find no conflict.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Count #1.
The Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence towards any person
-No contact with Tanya Wolf, except the defendant may return to the 102 E. Truman St address or any other address occupied by Ms. Wolf on one occasion with law enforcement to obtain personal belongings

Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant will now qualify for SPD representation in 14CF178.
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Attorney Svehlek and ADA Hall stipulate to this case tracking with 14CF178.

Recess: 3:28 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 6/18/14 at 10:00 am (If Br. 4 finds it to be appropriate 14cF178)
Status: 6/27/14 at 9:30 am (If Br. 4 finds it to be appropriate to track with 14cF178)
